name: Big Data for Social Good Challenge

venue.name: Big Data for Social Good Challenge

description:
CALLING ALL DEVELOPERS .... JOIN THE BIG DATA FOR SOCIAL GOOD CHALLENGE

Big data exists in just about everything we use and do. It comes from phones, cars, roads, power lines, waterways, food crates, and innumerable other items you’d never think of as computers. This data speaks volumes about our collective behavior and society – so let’s use it to do something incredible! IBM invites developers and data enthusiasts to take a deep dive into real world civic issues using big data and the IBM Bluemix Analytics for Hadoop service. Analyze one of our curated datasets or bring your own (provided it meets these requirements)! Use Hadoop and your data to create a clickable and interactive data visualization to highlight insights that you’ve found.

Ready to get started? $40,000 in prizes will be awarded....

Register here:http://ibmhadoop.challengepost.com/

What to Create: Participants must create a working, clickable, and interactive data visualization utilizing the Analytics for Hadoop service on IBM Bluemix.

Data Requirements: Your data visualization must analyze one or more datasets included in the curated list of datasets on the Data page OR meet the data size, content, and licensing requirements described on the Data page. The total size of the Datasets analyzed must be between 500MB - 7GB in size.

Check out the requirements then go get your IBM Bluemix extended promo code and check out the datasets!

name: BigData and Analytics Lab

venue.name: IBM Innovation Center Tokyo
venue.address_1: 18th Floor, Shibuya Mark City WEST, Tokyo, Tokyo

description:
Hands-on lab for BigData and Analytics services using IBM Bluemix (PaaS). Admission free.


Agenda:


1) IBM BigData and Analytics Strategy in Bluemix


2) Hands-on labs

-Analytics for Hadoop on Bluemix
-Create a business intelligence and analytics service in Ruby with Analytics Warehouse on IBM Bluemix
-Build a data mining app using Java, Weka, and the Analytics Warehouse service
-Leverage IBM Cognos on IBM Bluemix using the Embeddable Reporting service

---------------------------------------------------------

Prerequisites:

Presentation is conducted in Japanese. (Hands-on materials are in Engligh)

name: BluemixでHadoopデータを分析する

venue.name: Connecting The Dots
venue.address_1: 東京都渋谷区神南1-20-7川原ビル４階

description:
Hadoopをブラウザから簡単に操作できるBluemixの「IBM Analytics for Hadoop」サービスを使ったハンズオン・コースです。

Hadoopの環境を準備し、データをインポートしてデータ分析を行うまでの一連の手順を解説します。Hadoopデータへのアクセスは”BigSheets”というExcelのようなスプレッドシートを利用する方法や、”Big SQL”という慣れ親しんだSQLを使ったアクセスなど、とても簡単にデータを利用する方法をご紹介し、実際に体験していただきます。

■参加希望の方は事前にBluemixのIDを取得の上、PC持参にて参加ください。

<<BluemixフリートライアルID取得方法>>


http://ibm.biz/bluemix2015  にアクセスし、右上の「登録」をクリック。
画面にしたがって入力し送信。その後、登録したメールアドレスにメールが送られるので、メール内の Click here to complete your registration をクリック。これでBluemixにログインして使用することができるようになります。
メール内からのクリックを行わないと使用できませんのでご注意ください。


みなさまの参加をお待ちしております。


*This meetup is held in Japanese.

name: IBM | Spark - The Start of Something Big in Data and Design(WEB CONFERENCE ONLY)
description:
THIS IS A WEB CONFERENCE ONLY.  TIME OF WEB CONFERENCE LOCALLY IS BASED ON LIVE-STREAM START - PACIFIC DAYLIGHT TIME. DETAILS TO CONNECT TO LIVE-STREAM ARE INDICATED BELOW. 

Apache Spark is an open source processing engine built around speed, ease of use, and analytics. If you have large amounts of data that requires low latency processing that a typical Map Reduce program cannot provide, Spark is the alternative.

Spark performs at speeds up to 100 times faster than Map Reduce for iterative algorithms or interactive data mining. Spark provides in-memory cluster computing for lightning fast speed and supports Java, Scala, and Python APIs for ease of development. Spark allows data scientists to build models quickly and supports iterative jobs on distributed datasets. This means more people can apply deep intelligence into applications to make everything smarter, including the Internet of Things (IoT), machine learning, web, mobile, social, business process and more.
Do you believe in the value of Spark, in the speed, efficiency and flexibility of this in-memory compute engine? IBM does.  Emphatically.

That's why we're committed to do everything we can to accelerate the adoption of Spark for enterprise analytics, where Spark promises seemingly unlimited value. On June 15, 2015, IBM will host a Spark Community event in San Francisco, California: IBM | Spark - The Start of Something Big in Data and Design. There will be a live demo showcase, refreshments, and a Town Hall discussion featuring some of the most trail-blazing data scientists in today's Spark Community, including:
   Edd Dumbill, VP Strategy, Silicon Valley Data Science
•  Mike Tamir, Chief Science Officer & VP of Data Science & Education at Galvanize
•   Fernando Perez, Staff Scientist at Lawrence Berkeley National Laboratory & Founding Investigator of the Berkeley Institute for Data Science
•   Haoyuan Li, CEO and Founder of Tachyon Nexus
•   Shankar Venkataraman, Distinguished Engineer & CTO, IBM Analytics Platform at IBM
•   Paco Nathan, Director, Community Evangelism, Databricks

Spark Community members will also deliver 5-minute lightning talks to describe exciting projects they're working on.

We will provide a livestream presentation of what these Spark leaders have to say.

Live Streaming Link:

http://www.ibm.com/analytics/us/en/technology/spark/

Scroll down to "Can't attend in Person"?  Sign up for a reminder and add it to your calendar.

Link to Spark Fundamentals Course in Big Data University

http://bigdatauniversity.com/bdu-wp/bdu-course/spark-fundamentals/

Happy Sparkling.

Thank you.

name: IBM Insight 2015 ( and Sponsorships )
description:
For IBM Insight Registration,

Please apply from the site below:

http://www-01.ibm.com/software/events/insight/agenda/schedule/

Dear IBM Business Partner,

Insight 2015 will take place October 25 - 29 at the Mandalay Bay, Las Vegas and we are proud to announce the Sponsorship and Exhibit sales will open on Wednesday, May 27 at 10am CST.  

Here are some preliminary details to help you prepare to select your sponsor package:

• Sponsorship Prospectus - Attached (at the end of this email) is the Insight 2015 Sponsorship Prospectus which outlines the Sponsorship, Exhibit and Marketing Promotional items that we have available.  Please take a few moment to review the information prior to submitting your online application.   

• Online application - You can submit your online application at the following website (https://www-950.ibm.com/events/wwe/insight/insight15expo.nsf/exspApplication).  

• Open floor plan - The show floor will continue to follow an open floor plan again this year using our new architecture that enhances the overall EXPO experience and promotes attendee networking.  The Solution EXPO will continue to evolve from a traditional trade show into a destination where attendees want – and have a reason – to spend time during the event.

• Plus sponsorship packages - We will continue to offer a full-service experience via our Plus packages -- remember, these also afford you a premium location on the show floor. While you can continue to bring your own booth architecture, we encourage you to take advantage of the larger booth space of the Plus packages and save the cost of shipping your booth, selecting individual elements for your space, etc.

• Marketing Promotional Opportunities - We have enhanced the Marketing Promotional Opportunities to include new offerings with price points ranging from $2,000 to $50,000 to help you increase your exposure. Please review the Sponsorship Prospectus for a listing of these items.

• Booth selection - Booth space selection will be assigned based on the sponsorship level, then on the order that contracts are received.   

• Logo - Your logo is required and must be submitted within 10 days of your contract submission.  We cannot promote your presence until we have received your logo.

• Pricing  - The Early Bird deadline is September 4.  All applications, must be received by end of day on September 4 in order to receive the Early Bird price


 


We look forward to working with you and your team as we prepare for our biggest, most comprehensive Solution EXPO ever!

Sincerely,


Insight 2015 Solution EXPO Sales Team

name: Data Engineering Conference 2015 Feedback
description: 翔泳社は2015年11月17日、東京・六本木にあるベルサール六本木にて「Data Engineering Conference 2015 Powered by Developers Summit」を開催しました（協賛：日本IBM）。Apache Sparkと機械学習、データ基盤にフォーカスした未来志向のテクノロジーカンファレンスです。「はじめてのSpark」の著者としても有名なHolden Karau氏をはじめ、IBM Spark Technology Centerの技術者も来日し、500名以上の来場者により非常な盛り上がりを見せました。講演内容の詳細はこちら。資料のダウンロードも可能です。

name: Apache Spark Maker Community Event
description:
THIS MEETUP AND LIVE STREAMING IS US PACIFIC STANDARD TIME (PST). PLEASE CONVERT TO YOUR TIME ZONE.

On June 6, 2016, leading minds in data and analytics from Tesla, Netflix, Silicon Valley Data Science, and IBM will come together to demonstrate how open data and analytics technologies such as R, Spark, Python and more are forming a vibrant ecosystem.  The community has a shared goal of working with all data to build unexpected insights and launch new business applications.

The Apache Spark Maker Community Event will bring together data scientists, data engineers, data developers, and data designers June 6th @ 6pm at Galvanize, San Francisco. Here’s the plan:   

- The Big Reveal – New sample Apache Spark apps and tools

- Use Cases – Monsanto will share how they are using R and Spark to optimize their supply chain

- Learning Session - Hear from experts working on Spark projects and building the Spark ecosystem of open data and analytics technologies

- Networking Opportunity – Food, drinks and data, explore a Hall of Innovation showcasing Spark demos

Join us. Learn more here: 

Apache Spark Maker Community Event 

We realize you may not be able to attend in person, however, we are live streaming the event.  Register for the live stream and we'll send you a calendar update and login link.

name: Broadcast: Tech Talk: Apache Quarks
description:
IBM developerWorks Open Tech Talk

Apache Quarks
Categories: Analytics, Internet of Things

Wed June 8th 11 AM ET Abstract:

Apache Quarks is an open source development tool that makes it easier for developers to create Internet of Things (IoT) applications to analyze data on the edge of their networks. Learn more.

In the developerWorks Open Tech Talk series you will:

- Learn more about the technology driving IBM open source projects
- Meet the IBM innovators who are creating exciting new applications in major technology focus areas
- Discover how you can use and improve these applications for your own business


Web Meeting/Replay/Charts: http://ibm.6connex.com/event/developerWorksOpen/en-us/contents/58875/share?rid=ibmhome&nid=186998

Tips:
Register or log in (IBMers do not use your intranet pwd). This is an external site.
No phone conference. Audio is through web meeting.
Firefox 38 works fine, no need to upgrade. Click Skip and Continue at the System Check.
If you can't get into the meeting, use the conference # for the visually impaired below.
Note, there is a known issue on Firefox (Symantec blocks Flash). See instructions here.
If you have difficulty, switch browsers or use a mobile device (download XPOCAST app).
Visually or Hearing impaired conference #.

name: IBM DB2 Ver11 Just Released !!! (Jun 15)
description:
IBM DB2 V11 for Linux, UNIX and Windows! Coming to a Server near you today! Check out the updated Web page - http://bit.ly/DB2v11Web

DB2 11.1 - A DB2 release that doubles down on data protection
http://ibm.co/1WIsfm5

「IBM DB2 11」は、複数のデータベースを一つの仮想データベースとして扱い、他社製データベースやHadoopなどへも透過的にアクセスできるフェデレーション機 能を標準装備することで、ハイブリッド・クラウド環境でのトランザクションおよびアナリティクスの両ワークロードへの対応をさらに強化します。また、イン メモリーとカラムナー処理などを得意とするBLU Acceleration機能を超並列処理 (MPP) ネットワーク・クラスター・アーキテクチャーに導入することで、パフォーマンスが向上します。最新のIBM DB2では、オンプレミスとクラウドのライセンス体系を共通化したDB2 Direct Standard Editionおよび DB2 Direct Advanced Editionを提供します。

https://www-03.ibm.com/press/jp/ja/pressrelease/49723.wss

The IBM Webinar :

Do more with your existing data infrastructure!. Learn innovative ways to drive incremental values from data infrastructure investments! More details here - bit.ly/v11launchwebcast


<a href="http://ibm.co/1WIsfm5"></a>

name: Show Us Your Apps - Apache Spark Maker Build Global Hackathon
description:
THIS IS A GLOBAL ON-LINE HACKATHON THAT BEGINS MAY 23, 2016 AND NOW ENDS AUGUST 23, 2016.  SUBMISSIONS DUE AUGUST 23rd BY 5:00 PM EST. 

We’re extending the hackathon deadline to August 23 - that’s 20 additional days to build your Spark enterprise app. (View the revised competition calendar HERE.  We're giving you more time because....

We’re adding new enterprise data resources to the site and we want to give you a chance to incorporate these into your projects, if you so choose.  Our awesome data co-sponsors Yelp and Uncharted Software have generously shared some of their enterprise data sets for you to use during the hackathon.

Yelp’s data includes 2.2M reviews by 552K users for 77K businesses. The Uncharted data includes Bitcoin network transactions from processing the Bitcoin blockchain as of mid-2014 and Amazon product reviews from 1995 through 2003. For a fuller description and data access, visit our resources page.

Uncharted Software also has a couple cool Spark data visualization libraries you should check out: Salt and SparkPipe.

And, in case you’d like to weigh the effects of weather on business operations, we’re also offering access to the full suite of Weather Company APIs for the duration of the hackathon.

Finally, if you’re looking for a hosting solution for your Spark app, we’re now offering extended Bluemix trials for all hackathon participants. Using Bluemix services to build your project is totally optional, but might be a good way to get your app up and running — particularly with the IBM Analytics for Apache Spark service.

You can request your extended Bluemix trial code here.  For all hackathon participants, trials will extend through November 1, 2016. Now go forth and optimize for the enterprise!

---------------------

Build an Apache Spark application to address a real business problem or core concern related to customer care, marketing, risk management or operations. Join IBM and Devpost for a global hackathon using Apache Spark Makers Build.  There are $100,000 in cash prizes.  Submissions can be sent in up to August 23rd.

Participation Details: To participate in the global virtual hackathon, you can register here.  Please review all registration guidelines.

For the hack, you will apply Apache Spark's powerful analytics capabilities to enterprise and other relevant data so data scientists and software developers can build an analytics or mobile/web app that tackles a key business problem in marketing, customer case, operations or risk management.  The grand prize is $50,000, and the top three winners each get a meeting with the judge or
Spark community expert of their choice; the judging panel includes data experts from Tesla, Netflix, and Silicon Valley Data Science.

Go to apachespark.devpost.com for full details and registration.  Please review all registration rules.

Questions?

We're here to help. If you have any questions about the hackathon, post on the discussion forum or email support@devpost.com and we'll respond as soon as we can.

name: DataFirst Launch Event – Experience new ways to put your data to work
description:
On September 27, 2016, leading minds in data and analytics will come together and unveil the latest in cloud technology, enabling you to more efficiently put data to work. Experience how Spark, Hadoop, Python, and more are being used to bring together all types of data professionals –from data engineers, to data scientists, developers and business analysts –to work in new collaborative ways.

The IBM DataFirst Launch Event will unite data and analytics leaders and practitioners from the open source community, startups, and enterprises. Check the event site for the latest lineup of guest speakers. The event takes place @ 6pm at the Hudson Mercantile Building, NYC.

Here’s the plan:
• The Big Reveal –Experience new ways to work for data engineers, data scientist, developers, and business analysts, both individually and collectively.

•Hands-on sessions – With interactive experiences for each of these professions.

•Use Cases –Community leaders and guest speakers will share their expertise and vision
•Networking Opportunity – Food, drinks, data, collaborative demos, and a party on the rooftop

Learn more here:  DataFirst Launch Event

Check-in and networking begins at 6:00 PM.  Food and drinks will be served. You must register for this event.

To get your ticket, and attend in person, click HERE.  

Can't attend in person? We'll be live streaming this event.  Register for the LIVE STREAM and we'll send you a calendar update and login link.

name: LoopBack is a highly extensible, open-source Node.js framework based on Express
description:
IBM developerWorks Open Tech Talk : LoopBack

Wed Oct 12th 11 AM ET LoopBack is a highly extensible, open-source Node.js framework based on Express that enables you to quickly create dynamic end-to-end REST APIs and connect to backend systems such as databases and SOAP or REST services. Learn more.

The goal of the developerWorks Open Tech Talks series is to help you:


• Learn more about the technology driving IBM open source projects

• Meet the IBM innovators who are creating exciting new applications in major technology focus areas

• Discover how you can use and improve these applications for your own business


 


Please register here: https://ibmblueprint.zoom.us/webinar/register/15819bba8e77293dcde7dc3c8da9331e


After registering, you will see a link to join the webinar. You will also receive a confirmation email with dial-in details.

Charts will be posted prior to the meeting here: https://developer.ibm.com/open/events
Replay and Charts will be posted after the meeting here: https://developer.ibm.com/open/videos

name: IBM World of Watson 2016
description:
⼤量のデータが⼿に⼊るようになった現在、「デジタル・ビジネス」を実現するだけでは顧客の期待を越えることはできません。先進的な企業ではデジタル・インテリジェンスを取り⼊れた「コグニティブ・ビジネス」を実現しつつあります。データを知識に変え、⼈間の専⾨性を⾼め、驚異的な速さで変化する市場のニーズを先取りするーコグニティブ・ビジネスは⼈とコンピューターとの関わり⽅を根本から変えようとしています。
「IBM World of Watson 2016」は、昨年までの「World of Watson」と「Insight」を融合し、全く新しいイベントとして⽣まれ変わります。
データやアナリティクス、そしてWatsonがどのように業務を変⾰し、コグニティブ・ビジネスを実現するのか、ぜひ最新の動きをお確かめください。

＜開催概要＞
⽇程： 2016年10⽉24⽇(⽉)－27⽇(⽊) (ビジネスパートナーDay 23⽇)
会場： ⽶国ネバダ州ラスベガス
Mandalay Bay Hotel / T-Mobile Arena
公式サイト：ibm.com/software/events/wow/

name: You can download IBM World of Watson 2016 Presentations
description:
Thank You for Being Part of World of Watson 2016


http://www-01.ibm.com/software/events/wow/

name: IBM developerWorks Open Tech Talk : EclairJS
description:
Wed Nov 9th 11 AM ET

EclairJS provides JavaScript developers with an API to Apache Spark so they can take advantage of Spark’s scalable streaming, SQL, machine-learning, graph capabilities.


Join the EclairJS team for a closer look at this exciting project, including an overview of both the client component, which provides a Spark API in Node.js and JavaScript and enables Node.js applications to run remotely from Spark, and the server component, which exposes the Apache Spark programming model to JavaScript and takes advantage of Spark’s distributed computing capabilities.


Register to attend Zoom Webinar: https://ibmblueprint.zoom.us/webinar/register/3a399f726cdcfdf88c34be5db4a05ad8?cm_mc_uid=11752392323214755868059&cm_mc_sid_50200000=1478028858
After registering, you will see a link to join the webinar. You will also receive a confirmation email with dial-in details.

Or Watch on Ustream Channel: http://www.ustream.tv/channel/6Tc4cBmqFXB
Live captioning: https://www.streamtext.net/player?event=developerworksopentechtalks
Charts will be posted prior to the meeting here: https://developer.ibm.com/open/events
Replay will be available on Ustream here: http://www.ustream.tv/channel/6Tc4cBmqFXB
Transcript, Q&A, Charts, and Replay will be posted after the meeting here: https://developer.ibm.com/open/videos

name: IBM Champions - Call for Nominations
description:
IBM values our community of clients and business partners. Each year, we support and build our community by working closely with IBM advocates and helping them to become 

IBM Champions

IBM Champions are a select group of external advocates made up of clients, business partners and independent consultants who make exceptional contributions to the technical community by speaking at conferences, running or actively participating in user groups, evangelizing relevant technical topics via social media, and helping our clients make the most of IBM technology. 

We are looking for clients and business partners to join the program and are looking for applications in the areas of data science, data engineering, application development, and business analytics.

Nominations are due by Monday, November 28, 2016

The Champion program is open to candidates worldwide, and candidates may self-nominate or be nominated by someone else. IBM employees are not eligible for the program.  Some benefits of the IBM Champion program: 
- IBM Champions advocate IBM offerings in the community with competence and credibility (content, blogs, presentations, customer references, analyst/press, videos/podcasts, etc.)
- IBM Champions share knowledge with and provide support to the IBM user community (books, articles, blogs, forums, presentations, education, beta programs and customer advisory councils etc.)
- IBM Champions support IBM as brand ambassadors who build awareness, share product knowledge, and provide product feedback as users and beta testers

Read this  blog post  for full IBM Champion program criteria, guidelines and the <a>nomination form</a>.

To learn more about the IBM Champion program from current Champions and Worldwide IBM Champion coordinator Libby Ingrassia, listen to this webcast. Be sure to share the blog and webcast with clients and colleagues who would make great IBM Champions.

name: Strata+Hadoop World 2016 Singapore (DEC 5-8)
description:
Dive deep into the business of big data

Connect, share case studies and best practices, and learn the tools and techniques essential for success—along with insights to help you plan for a data-driven future.

http://www.oreilly.com/pub/cpc/25479


Conference Discount: Strata + Hadoop World Singapore 2016
Strata + Hadoop World in Singapore, happening December 5-8, is where cutting-edge data science and new business fundamentals merge. It’s a deep-immersion experience where data scientists, analysts, and business executives dissect case studies, develop new skills, share emerging best practices, and build the future of big data. Save 20% with discount code USRG. Check out the impressive agenda and speaker lineup.

Also, 83 Free Data Ebooks from O'Reilly
An archive of all O'Reilly data ebooks is available for free download.
Dive deep into the latest in data science and big data, compiled by O'Reilly editors, authors, and Strata speakers.


http://www.oreilly.com/pub/cpc/28947

name: Hyperledger Update : IBM developerWorks Open Tech Talk
description:
Wed Dec 14th 11 AM ET Interest and energy has been pouring into the Hyperledger Project, which was launched in 2016 by the Linux Foundation to provide blockchain technologies for the enterprise. Blockchain technology is the underpinning of Bitcoin, but its application goes far beyond alternate currencies. Blockchain can be used to address information-management problems in a decentralized manner. This is valuable not only to the financial industry, but also in healthcare, environmental monitoring, emerging-market credit, supply chains, even education. name: Machine Learning Launch
description:
The demand for machine learning is booming! 

Calling all IT executives, data scientists, Chief Data Officers, data architects and other data geeks.  Join us on February 15th from 2:00-5:30 pm ET via livestream  (replay available starting February 16th) , and discover how machine learning is fundamentally changing the way we work and live.  Hear about cognitive applications that anticipate behavior and learn from data without being explicitly programmed.

You'll learn about the latest breakthrough developments on machine learning as well as Spark, data and analytics. Mike Gualtieri, Vice President and Principal Analyst, Forrester, will present his view on how to best leverage technologies such as big data, predictive analytics, Hadoop/Spark, machine learning, data science, and AI.  Rob Thomas, General Manager, IBM Analytics will host an agenda which will include guest speakers and cover the following topics:

•  Machine Learning Overview

•  Top Trends in Machine Learning & Cognitive Applications

•  Cognitive Analytics and Machine Learning for the Enterprise

•  Live Product Demonstration & Client Roundtable on Machine Learning

•  Data Innovation with Hybrid Transaction/Analytical Processing

•  Spark & Machine Learning for Enterprise Systems

For additional details and to REGISTER, please visit MACHINE LEARNING.

Register NOW and we'll send you a reminder!
how_to_find_us: Livestream is Eastern Standard Time (EST) - Adjust to your time zone

name: ビッグデータ活用セミナー～改正個人情報保護法の全面施行に向けて～

venue.name: 日本アイ・ビー・エム株式会社 本社事業所（東京都中央区）
venue.address_1: 〒103-8510 東京都中央区日本橋箱崎町１９－２１

description:
【3/8開催】ビッグデータ活用セミナー　
　　　　　　　　～改正個人情報保護法の全面施行に向けて～

本年5月30日より、改正個人情報保護法が全面施行されます。今回の改正では、個人の権利・利益の保護と個人情報の有効活用のバランスを図るべく、個人情報の定義がより明確になるとともに、それを含むデータの適正な利用のための匿名加工情報（特定の個人を識別することができないように個人情報を加工した情報）の利用規定も盛り込まれています。今後さらに活用が進むIoTのデータも、個人が所有するモバイル機器、電化製品、自動車などから多く発信されることを考えるならば、個人情報の塊であると言えます。
当セミナーでは、この改正個人情報保護法を概観するとともに、個人情報の適正な活用に資するソリューションについて、社外講師を交えてご紹介します。 お申込と詳しくは下記にて。


https://www.ibm.com/blogs/solutions/jp-ja/2017/02/bigdata-seminer01/

name: QISKit and quantum computing
description:
IBM developerWorks Open Tech Talk


QISKit and quantum computing

Wed March 29th 11 AM ET

Quantum computing has the potential to change everything we know about computing. Instead of ones and zeros, quantum bits — qubits (pronounced CUE-bits) — can represent a one, a zero, or both at once. Incredibly complex calculations are now within our grasp.

The QISKit open source project enables developers to conduct explorations on IBM’s Quantum Experience using a Python interface. Learn More.

name: Brunel Visualization update
description:
IBM developerWorks Open Tech Talk

Brunel Visualization update

Wed April 12th 11 AM ET

Join us for an update on Brunel Visualization, a domain specific language that defines a set of composable atomic “actions” that, when stitched together, produce an extraordinarily large variety of data visualizations. If you’re analyzing data, writing or presenting about data, or providing data within software, you’ll be able to take advantage of Brunel Visualization’s extraordinary capability to show off patterns visually. Learn More.
